page.title: 08DORNIE VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: Mr Gill has owned the Dornie general merchants shop for 35 years.He sells groceries,cakes,papers,sweets,milk, bread,coal and bottled gas.In the shop he has three full time and two part time staff.He keeps the books but an accountant looks after the tax.A typical day starts at 4.30am when he helps unload the milk lorry.He then delivers milk to the outlying areas returning to the shop to make up orders for the van salesman.He has breakfast about 11.30am.Sometimes he goes to Inverness to collect stock.He finishes at 8.00pm.Most of the local people buy things in his shop.His busiest time of the year is July and the busiest day of the week is Saturday.He enjoys his work but finds people less pleasant than when he started.
